abstract: With profit down 28 percent, Starbucks said it would open fewer new stores in the United States, slash expenses and sell better-tasting coffee.
snippet: With profit down 28 percent, Starbucks said it would open fewer new stores in the United States, slash expenses and sell better-tasting coffee.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Facing an increasingly stingy consumer, Starbucks is tightening its belt.

headline.main: Starbucks Reports 28% Drop in Profit and Trims Store Openings
headline.print_headline: Starbucks Reports 28% Drop in Profit and Trims Store Openings
